content: sunray cowl a little extra warmth for chilly days sparrow knits sunray cowl the weather recently dipped into the teens in our neck of the woods and i realized on my grocery rounds that half of my face went numb after just a few minutes outside i hopped from store to store to defrost and when i got home i started frantically knitting new face covers for the family and thus the sunray cowl was born knit densely out of a sumptuously soft yarn that feels like heaven next to the skin it can be worn under the chin on chilly days or all the way up to the nose when it s really frosty outside we ve been known to put ours on over a balaclava for extra warmth - the ribbing will stretch to accommodate an extra layer i promise you that no fall or winter wind will make it through happy knitting sparrow knits 2 © 2019 julia druk all rights reserved sunray cowl specifications sizes 0-3 months 3-12 months 12-24 months 2-4 years 4-9 years 9-15 years materials malabrigo worsted 210 yds/100 gm shown in marigold 1 1 1 1 2 2 skeins approximately 45 85 135 160 225 280 yards 41 77 123 146 205 256 meters gauge 26 stitches/38 row = 4 10cm in 2x2 rib 23 stitches/38 row = 4 10cm in stockinette needles us 4 3 5mm 16 40cm circular needles or dpns note you may want to use the magic loop method for smaller sizes in that case you ll need us 4 3 5mm 40 101cm circular needles tools tapestry needle for weaving in ends stitch marker techniques stretchy cast-on options given in pattern instructions jeny s stretchy bind off recommended 2x2 ribbing purl increases weaving in ends sparrow knits 3 © 2019 julia druk all rights reserved sunray cowl instructions abbreviations k knit pfb purl into the front and back of the p purl same stitch st/sts stitch/stitches cast on 68 76 84 92 100 104 sts with size us 4 cowl 3 5mm needles using a stretchy cast-on join placing marker for the beginning of the round your cast-on should stretch enough to easily make it over your kiddo s head setup row k2 p2 to end here are two that work perfectly work k2 p2 ribbing pattern for 12 15 20 25 25 30 jeny s stretchy cast on video row tutorial here http //www youtube com/watch want a taller cowl that you can fold over like a turtleneck knit v=3n8e3i6cg2k 5-10 more row before the first increase so the top can be folded over tillybuddy s stretchy cast on video tutorial here http //www youtube com/watch next increase row k2 pfb p1 to end v=itibtm0ql6a work new k2 p3 ribbing pattern for 5 10 15 15 15 20 more row next increase row k2 p1 pfb p1 to end your bind off should be similarly work new k2 p4 ribbing pattern for 5 10 15 15
